org.criteria4jpa
Interface Criteria

All Known Implementing Classes:
CriteriaImpl, SubCriteriaImpl
public interface Criteria

This class represents a single criteria query.

Use add(Criterion) to specify constraints on the query results. The static factory methods of Restrictions should be used to create new Criterion instances.

You can use createCriteria(String) or createCriteria(String, String) to build subcriteria for associated entities. These subcriteria are Criteria instances rooted at a different entity and can be used like the root criteria instance.

If you need to specify a specific ordering of your result, you may define ordering with addOrder(Order). The class Order contains static factory methods for Order objects.

After building a Criteria instance you can use getResultList() or getSingleResult() to execute the query.

Author:
Christian Kaltepoth

          Specifies a JOIN type.

Method Detail

getAlias

String getAlias()
Returns the alias of the entity referred to by this criteria instance.

Returns:
The alias for the entity.

add

Criteria add(Criterion criterion)
Add a Criterion to specify constraints on the results that the query should return. Use the static factory methods of the Restrictions class to create new Criterion objects.

Parameters:
criterion - The Criterion object representing the constraints for the criteria query.
Returns:
this (builder pattern)

addOrder

Criteria addOrder(Order order)
Add an Order object to specify the ordering of the results. Use the static factory methods of Order to create the required instance.

Parameters:
order - The Order object describing the ordering of the results.
Returns:
this (builder pattern)

setMaxResults

Criteria setMaxResults(int maxResults)
Set a limit on the maximal number of results to be retrieved.

Parameters:
maxResults - the maximum number of results
Returns:
this (builder pattern)

Set the first result to be retrieved.

Parameters:
firstResult - the first result to retrieve
Returns:
this (builder pattern)

getResultList

List getResultList()
Generates a Query from the Criteria instances and calls Query.getResultList().

Returns:
The list of matched query results.

getSingleResult

Object getSingleResult()

Generates a Query from the criteria instances and calls Query.getSingleResult() on it.

Returns:
result of Query.getSingleResult()

getSingleResultOrNull

Object getSingleResultOrNull()

Generates a Query from the criteria instances and calls Query.getSingleResult() on it.

If the underlying call to Query.getSingleResult() results in a NoResultException it will be automatically catched and null will be returned.

Use getSingleResult() if you want standard JPA behavior.

Returns:
result of Query.getSingleResult() or null

createCriteria

Criteria createCriteria(String relativePath)
Creates a subcriteria on the associated entity named by the supplied path expression. Creates a JPA query containing an equivalent join expression. If you want to assign an alias to the joined entity, use createCriteria(String, String) instead. This method will perform a Criteria.JoinType.INNER_JOIN.

Parameters:
relativePath - The path expression to the associated entity
Returns:
the created subcriteria

createCriteria

Criteria createCriteria(String relativePath,
                        Criteria.JoinType joinType)
Creates a subcriteria on the associated entity named by the supplied path expression. Creates a JPA query containing an equivalent join expression. If you want to assign an alias to the joined entity, use createCriteria(String, String) instead.

Parameters:
relativePath - The path expression to the associated entity
joinType - The type of join to perform
Returns:
the created subcriteria

createCriteria

Criteria createCriteria(String relativePath,
                        String alias)
Creates a subcriteria on the associated entity named by the supplied path expression. Creates a JPA query containing an equivalent join expression. Assigns the given alias to the joined entity. If you don't need to manually set an alias, use may use createCriteria(String) instead. This method will perform a Criteria.JoinType.INNER_JOIN.

Parameters:
relativePath - The path expression to the associated entity
alias - The alias assigned to the joined entity
Returns:
the created subcriteria

createCriteria

Criteria createCriteria(String relativePath,
                        String alias,
                        Criteria.JoinType joinType)
Creates a subcriteria on the associated entity named by the supplied path expression. Creates a JPA query containing an equivalent join expression. Assigns the given alias to the joined entity. If you don't need to manually set an alias, use may use createCriteria(String) instead.

Parameters:
relativePath - The path expression to the associated entity
alias - The alias assigned to the joined entity
joinType - The type of join to perform
Returns:
the created subcriteria

setProjection

Criteria setProjection(Projection projection)
Set a Projection for the query. Using a Projection will effectively create a custom SELECT and may be used to retrieve different objects than the root entity. Use the static factory methods of Projections to create individual Projection instances.

Parameters:
projection - The Projection describing the desired result of the query
Returns:
this (builder pattern)
